text: Guernésiais is a Norman language spoken on the Channel island of Guernsey. It is related to the Jèrriais language on nearby Jersey island. It is part of the Oïl languages family. Only 2% of the island's people speak the language. The most recent dictionary of Guernésais, Dictiounnaire Angllais-guernesiais by Marie de Garis, was released in 1967. It was revised in 1982. == References == Category:Languages of the Channel Islands Category:Guernsey
title: Guernésiais
